[I]0-i WAS writing in [the red - and - white marble hall]666-the red - and - white marble hall that morning — [I]0-i really had made a beginning on the first of the six stories . It was not a good beginning , but there it was . [I]0-i had reached page three , and knew that unless any domestic event more than commonly cataclysmic befell that day [I]0-i should see the sun set on twelve pages of laborious type - writing . The walls of [the marble hall]667-the marble hall are thick , and the windows look to the northeast , so that even when the sun is turning [the garden]223-the garden to fine gold , and [the westerly rooms]669-the westerly rooms to a burning , fiery furnace , [the hall]1783-the hall remains cool as a cave . Through the open door [I]0-i could see the feathery flowers of the Spanish chestnut ; through one window [I]0-i could see the copper - beech , wine - dark , and through the other a gap in [the avenue]671-the avenue showed [me]0-i a square of blue sky backing a single pillar of Normandy poplar , straight , slender , self- possessed . [The garden]223-the garden was full of bird noises and the faint rustle of leaves . In [the kitchen]236-the kitchen sounded the clink of silver — of electro - plate , to be more accurate — and the chime of china . The tapping of [my]0-i Remington hardly did more than underline a silence which it might have broken to an ear that loved its monotonous music less than did [mine]0-i . [The hall]1783-the hall is [the great highway of [the Red House]187-the red house]675-the great highway of the red house . [Chloe]45-chloe passed through now and then with duster and broom , with an armful of blue - frilled cushions , with a folded rug , with something that rattled in a covered waste - paper basket . [She]45-chloe looked at [me]0-i , and [I]0-i knew [she]45-chloe was wondering why [I]0-i did not ask [her]45-chloe what [she]45-chloe was playing at . But [I]0-i forbore , because [I]0-i had reached the fourth page , and [I]0-i dared not tempt fate by pausing to enjoy more deeply the charm of a life [my]0-i right to which [I]0-i ought , without doubt , even at that moment to be earning . Besides , [I]0-i feared to break the spell . When once the fatal third page is passed fluency holds [her]45-chloe own against ordinary attacks . Not against [Chloe]45-chloe , if one allows [her]45-chloe to begin to explain a new idea . Yet [my]0-i fingers worked more slowly , and [my]0-i full stops gave [me]0-i time to count forty instead of four , as [they]677-they tell [us]678-us to do at [school]679-school , just because [I]0-i could not either resist or understand a growing impression pression that [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife did not want [me]0-i to ask any questions . Had [I]0-i felt that it would please [her]162-my wife to be questioned . [I]0-i could have wrestled with the definite temptation to please [her]162-my wife , and have thrown it . As it was , [my]0-i phrases grew feebler , [my]0-i narrative less convincing . [I]0-i had to clutch with both hands at [my]0-i vanishing interest in [my]0-i story ; and when the struggle was over [I]0-i found that [I]0-i had complicated the career of [[my]0-i hero]681-my hero with [two wives]682-two wives , [a dissipated youth]683-a dissipated youth , and a proposed highway robbery . And [[my]0-i hero]681-my hero was intended to shine in a milieu of “ strong domestic interest . ”[45-chloe] [I]0-i gathered the pages together ; it was lunchtime . The blue and gold of the morning were overclouded with thick gray ; the sky looked like the canvas roof of a travelling - circus tent . A few first drops made splashes on the door - step big as five - shilling pieces . Then down came the rain — straight , strong , masterful . “ [I]45-chloe knew it was going to rain , ”[45-chloe] said [Chloe]45-chloe . “ How good it is to hear it ! [We]2106-we 're like [Columbus]84-columbus , [madam]169-madam . The really important thing is to find out for [one]1622-one 's self , without any sort of mistake , what are the things [one]1622-one cares about — the things that matter — ”[693-i] “ And the things [one]1622-one does n't care about — those are much more important — the things one has just because [other people]513-other people have them — at least , if that 's not the reason [I]0-i do n't know what is . And [we]2106-we 've so much to learn , and there are so many good qualities [I]0-i know nothing about . Do n't [you]0-i feel very poor and unimportant , [Len]47-len ? And very , very ignorant ? [I]0-i do . ”[0-i] “ [I]693-i know one or two important things , ”[693-i] said [I]0-i , for [I]0-i never encourage [Chloe]45-chloe in the moods of humility that end in self - reproaches , “ and [I]45-chloe have one or two unimportant possessions — [the Red House]187-the red house , and [a wife]2120-a wife , and a loafery . What does it hang by ? Why , there are bars ! This must have been [the nursery]2122-the nursery . ”[45-chloe] “ Yes , ”[0-i] said [Chloe]45-chloe , leaning [her]45-chloe chin on [my]0-i shoulder , as [she]45-chloe stood behind [me]0-i . “ It would make [a splendid nursery]2123-a splendid nursery , too , ”[162-my wife] said [I.]0-i “ Yes , ”[162-my wife] said [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife again , still with [her]162-my wife chin on [my]0-i shoulder . “ [Len]47-len , [I]45-chloe feel very silly indeed , to - day ; [I]45-chloe should like to say something stupid . ”[45-chloe] “ [You]47-len could n't offer [me]45-chloe a greater novelty . ”[45-chloe] [She]45-chloe slipped [her]45-chloe hand into [my]0-i arm , and laid [her]45-chloe cheek against [my]0-i coat sleeve . “ [You]0-i know [you]0-i thought it was so mad of [me]0-i wanting to come to [the Red House]187-the red house , but [I]0-i saw [these bars]2125-these bars that very first day , and [I]0-i thought how nice it would be for [them]2125-these bars to have [a beautiful place to remember when they grow up]2126-a beautiful place to remember when they grow up . The summer day when , if [our]698-we eyes were dim , it was with the dew of morning , when , if [our]698-we hands trembled , it was because they held such full measure of life 's good things . [Yolande]52-yolande shall advise [us]2134-we . ”[2133-the duke] That evening when [Yolande]52-yolande and [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife were deep in a discussion on the way in which [a really right - minded dressmaker]700-a really right - minded dressmaker should cut a skirt , [I]0-i strolled into [the new room]701-the new room , and there on the table was [Chloe]45-chloe 's drawing of [the duke]2133-the duke and [the humble companion]703-the humble companion . [I]0-i always took the drawing prize in [my]0-i youth — nothing to boast of , since , proverbially , it falls to “ the greatest muff in the school”—and[45-chloe] at [Oxford]23-oxford [I]0-i had taken a keen pleasure in caricaturing [those who sit in the seats of [the mighty]707-the mighty]706-those who sit in the seats of the mighty , and in idealizing [those who stand behind the counters of [the pastry - cook]709-the pastry - cook]708-those who stand behind the counters of the pastry - cook . This , [I]0-i suppose , is [a lover]752-a lover 's commonplace . It was [our]747-we abiding marvel . During the next week [Yolande]52-yolande worked a good deal in [[her]52-yolande room]573-her room , bicycled a little with [me]0-i , went to [town]168-town once or twice with [Chloe]45-chloe , and entirely won the heart of [Mary]75-mary , who stated publicly that [she]75-mary would lie down for [Miss Yo]89-miss yo to walk on if it would please [her]75-mary . Twice in that week the ghost walked . [It]755-it finished a story for [me]0-i , and [I]0-i wished it would mind [its]755-it own business . But [I]0-i had been positively shocked to find [myself]0-i capable of a feeling towards [Yolande]52-yolande that was very like jealousy , and just because [I]0-i knew deep in [my]0-i heart that the ghost 's work was better than [my]0-i own , [I]0-i felt that it was equally impossible for [me]0-i to insist on an explanation , or to refuse to send in the ghost 's work as [mine]0-i . [I]0-i had given away [my]0-i ignoble secret to [Chloe]45-chloe now , and [I]0-i could not dare to sink further in [her]45-chloe eyes . So [I]0-i sent in the ghost 's work , and [the editor]167-the editor was delighted . The pricking of that same jealousy stung [me]0-i to correct two of [Chloe]45-chloe 's drawings and to originate a third . It was balm to [me]0-i to hear [Chloe]45-chloe 's raptures over the drawings , and to know that [she]45-chloe believed them to be the work of [Yolande]52-yolande — [Yolande]52-yolande , who could not have done anything half so good to save [her]45-chloe life . It was on the evening before [Mary]75-mary 's wedding . [I]0-i had presented to [her]75-mary a neat service of teacups and saucers , and [Chloe]45-chloe had embroidered for [her]75-mary a tea - cloth and a collar . [I]0-i almost think [she]75-mary had sewn tears into the pretty pattern . [Mary]75-mary had thanked [me]0-i for [my]0-i gifts and for [my]0-i heartfelt expressions of grief at parting from [her]75-mary , but it was not till [Chloe]45-chloe presented [her]45-chloe gifts worked by [her]45-chloe own hands that [Mary]75-mary broke down . “ [I]75-mary ai n't a - going to leave [you]0-i , [mum]2014-mum , ”[75-mary] [she]75-mary sobbed . “ [Miss Yo]89-miss yo [she]89-miss yo told [me]45-chloe not to say nothing , so as to make it a regular surprise for [you]0-i when [I]45-chloe come back . [I]45-chloe 'm only going for a week along of [[my]45-chloe Jim]2193-my jim to see [[his]2193-my jim father]2194-his father and [mother]2195-mother down [Marden way]25-marden way , and then [I]45-chloe 'm coming back . Not to live with [[his]48-jim wife]2198-his wife ? ”[75-mary] “ Oh , [mum]2014-mum , ”[75-mary] said [Mary]75-mary , giggling through [her]75-mary tears , “ [Miss Yo]89-miss yo arranged it all . It was a simple solution , was n't it ? Yet [Chloe]45-chloe and [I]0-i had never thought of it . And [I]0-i had lost [my]0-i Shropshire Lad . [MARY]75-mary 'S wedding was to be a quiet one . [I]0-i own that it was with an invigorating sense of something pleasant promised that [I]0-i awoke next morning . The feeling deepened as [I]0-i stole down - stairs and lighted the kitchen fire . [I]0-i do not know which of [us]795-us most enjoyed the house - work that followed . [Chloe]45-chloe loves house - work for its own sake . For [myself]0-i , [I]0-i admit that when [I]0-i see [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife working about [the house]1610-the house [I]0-i experience a more intimate sense of possession even than when [I]0-i walk with [her]162-my wife in [the garden]223-the garden , hand in hand , and certainly far deeper than [I]0-i can ever feel when [she]162-my wife is drawing away for dear life to add [her]162-my wife share to [our]795-us income . This is the relic of a barbarous age , and so is the delightful thrill of domestic pleasure with which [I]0-i see [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife busy about [[our]795-us house]481-our house . At the same time [I]0-i like to prove to [her]162-my wife that [I]0-i can sweep and dust and wash up as well as [she]162-my wife can , if not better . [My]0-i exercise with broom , mop , and the other implements of domestic industry seemed rather to have brightened [my]0-i brain than to have dulled it . [My]0-i story went very well . [I]0-i had a good plot which [Yolande]52-yolande had suggested , and [the type - writer]804-the type - writer clicked merrily . [I]0-i was in the middle of a fine scene between [a baffled company promoter]805-a baffled company promoter and [the simple typist girl who has out witted [him]805-a baffled company promoter on [his]805-a baffled company promoter own ground]806-the simple typist girl who has out witted him on his own ground , when [I]0-i heard the familiar , long - drawn shriek of the front gate . “ The milk , ”[813-the voice] [I]0-i thought . And [I]0-i also thought that perhaps [Chloe]45-chloe would not like to face [the milkman barefooted]807-the milkman barefooted , so [I]0-i went down . [I]0-i went softly , for [I]0-i happened to be wearing rubber - soled tennis shoes . In [the gallery]687-the gallery overlooking [the hall]1783-the hall [I]0-i paused , for [I]0-i heard a voice that was neither [Chloe]45-chloe 's nor [the milkman's]810-the milkman's — a thin , mean , narrow , doubtfully pitched voice . It came from the front doorstep . In the middle of [the hall]1783-the hall stood the stack of china shining with soap and water . Half the floor of [the hall]1783-the hall was cleaned , the other half partially wetted . A pail of brown - colored water stood by the table , and [Chloe]45-chloe , [her]45-chloe bare feet splashed with that same brown water , and a scrubbing - brush in [her]45-chloe hand , advanced towards [the voice]813-the voice . [The voice]813-the voice said , “ Is [[your]0-i mistress]485-your mistress at [home]244-home ? ”[162-my wife] There was an instant of hesitation . Then [I]0-i saw by the set of [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife 's shoulders that [she]162-my wife scorned to accept the chance of escape . “ Will [you]0-i come in ? ”[162-my wife] [she]162-my wife said , cheerfully . “ Mind the pail . [I]559-the woman ca n't shake hands with [you]0-i , because of the scrubbing - brush . ”[559-the woman] [The woman]559-the woman had not offered to shake hands . [She]559-the woman came in — a face and figure that matched the voice — a bonnet and mantle that matched the face and [the figure]817-the figure . There were black beads about [her]559-the woman . HOW had [Yolande]52-yolande triumphantly justified [her]52-yolande boast — [her]52-yolande assertion , rather — that [she]52-yolande could do for [us]870-we what [we]870-we could not do for [ourselves]870-we . For the rest , [we]870-we were extraordinarily comfortable ; [our]870-we domestic service approached perfection , and was , humanly speaking , assured . There are three hundred and twenty - six of [them]2355-any young couple . ”[45-chloe] It is delightful to have three hundred and twenty - six peaches of [your]882-your very own . [We]886-we 'll make a big one while [we]886-we 're about it — a really impressive sideboard . ”[45-chloe] [We]886-we did make it - in something under three hours . Draped in the red liberty curtains hastily taken down from [[our]886-we bedroom]395-our bedroom , and covered with a fair white cloth , it was — being ten feet long and four feet high — positively crushing in its impressiveness . [We]886-we collected all the tables from the other rooms,—even the writing - table from the loafery was brought in — gate tables , Pembroke tables round tables , square tables , long narrow tables , [our]886-we own tables , [Mary]75-mary 's tables , and [Mrs. Bates]98-mrs. bates 's tables . [We]886-we selected the least leggy , and arranged [[our]886-we guests]888-our guests ' name - cards . The question of wall decorations agitated [us]886-we a good deal . “ If [we]886-we took every pikky [we]886-we 've got out of all [the other rooms]2360-the other rooms , ”[45-chloe] [Chloe]45-chloe said , “ they 'd hardly show in [this great barn]2361-this great barn . There ought to be some idea — Oh , [Len]47-len , of course ! wreaths of evergreens right up high — oh!—and a frieze of pink muslin , and the evergreens in loops and swags . Delicious ! ”[45-chloe] It takes some time to make properly graduated loops and swags for [a room forty feet by twenty - five]889-a room forty feet by twenty - five , and it takes some material . The evergreens in [[our]886-we garden]1847-our garden had not had such a pruning this many a year . But [we]886-we did it ; [we]886-we thought of [Yolande]52-yolande , and [we]886-we did not flinch , though [our]886-we fingers were blistered and [our]886-we backs a weariness long before the wreaths were done . The pink muslin proved to be too ruinously expensive , but [we]886-we bought a pink “ lining paper ”[45-chloe] and pasted it up , and when [we]886-we had nailed up the evergreens [we]886-we felt that the result almost paid for [our]886-we three days ' hard labor . [Chloe]45-chloe fell into [my]0-i arms in an ecstasy of mingled pride and exhaustion . “ It 's a dream , ”[45-chloe] [she]45-chloe said , “ [an Italian palace]2362-an italian palace ! But , oh , [I]45-chloe never want to touch box or yew or laurel again as long as [I]45-chloe live ! And [we]886-we 've only three days now ! There 'll hardly be time to cook anything . ”[45-chloe] A fury of egg - beating drove [me]0-i forth . [A man]713-a man , [I]0-i was assured , was worse than useless in matters of cuisine . The crisis was urgent ; [I]0-i forebore to complicate it by argument ; but [Soyer]101-soyer and [[his]101-soyer noble army of [followers]893-followers]892-his noble army of followers seemed to back up [my]0-i insulted sex , as [I]0-i walked down [the garden - paths]894-the garden - paths , whose breast - high weed growths , mown down by [Jim]48-jim in leisure moments , now permitted glimpses of low - hanging red and golden fruit and russet leaves . The hour was five — nominally tea - time — but what [man worthy the name]895-man worthy the name would thrust the need of boiling kettles on [two ardent women strenuous in the compounding of sweets]896-two ardent women strenuous in the compounding of sweets ? [I]0-i walked softly in the tennis shoes to which a country life seduces [the weaker brethren]897-the weaker brethren , and [the path]898-the path was still weed - grown enough to betray nothing of [my]0-i drawing near to the biggest of the peach - trees on [the red south wall]899-the red south wall . [The espaliers]900-the espaliers connived at [my]0-i approach by the shelter of [their]900-the espaliers wide - spread arms . Thus it was that [I]0-i came plump on [a man]713-a man , midway up [my]0-i wall ; [his]713-a man foot rested where a broken brick had been dislodged . [He]713-a man was handing up peaches — [my]0-i peaches — reserved for the high destiny of [auntal and avuncular palates]902-auntal and avuncular palates — to [a ruffian with a basket , who , in broad day , only one big garden 's breadth from a policeman - ferret]903-a ruffian with a basket , who , in broad day , only one big garden 's breadth from a policeman - ferret , sat astride [my]0-i wall . Some one whistled — it was not [I]0-i ; a spring , a swear , and [both villains]904-both villains vanished as if by magic into [the paddock]905-the paddock . [I]0-i climbed the wall ; [they]904-both villains had disappeared in the nettle - coverts of [[our]906-our orchard]686-our orchard ; nor , when [I]0-i threaded those coverts , could [I]0-i run them to [earth]280-earth . It was a poor consolation to return , [my]0-i feet soaked to the bone through [my]0-i tennis shoes , to count the peaches and to find that [the despicable outcasts]909-the despicable outcasts had only taken fifteen out of [the three hundred and twenty - six]910-the three hundred and twenty - six . How age mellows [one]1622-one 's views ! As [a boy]912-a boy [I]0-i never could understand why [farmers]913-farmers made such a fuss about a few apples or plums . Now , [all the land - owner]914-all the land - owner welled up within [me]0-i , and [I]0-i understood it all — with an understanding as full as it was bitter . [I]0-i thought of netting , of man - traps , of a fierce bull - dog , of [men with guns]915-men with guns — [myself]0-i and [Jim]48-jim by turns — incessantly patrolling ling [[my]0-i garden]916-my garden . All other crimes in the decalogue might , [I]0-i felt , admit of some valid excuse , some reasonable explanation . But breaking the eighth commandment — and with peaches — [my]0-i peaches — it was intolerable ! [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i cut off once and forever from the communion of [school - boys]917-school - boys . [Villon]102-villon was now merely despicable to [me]0-i . [No one who has not given a party of the dimensions of ours]926-no one who has not given a party of the dimensions of ours can have the least idea of the Herculean labors involved . [We]927-we all worked like [galley - slaves]928-galley - slaves , and on the morning before the party but little provision had been made save cakes , and the last batch of these were burned because [Chloe]45-chloe , who had undertaken to watch [their]929-their baking , had become all too deeply absorbed in the French cookery - book 's recipe for soles à la Normande , a dish which [we]927-we had neither the means nor the skill to prepare . [She]45-chloe came into [the hall]1783-the hall where [Yolande]52-yolande and [I]0-i were washing the best dessert service,—for so large a party all plates must be requisitioned,—sank on to a chair , stuck out [her]45-chloe feet straight before [her]45-chloe — an attitude recognized in [our]927-we code as indicating despair — and said : “ It 's no use ; [you]52-yolande 'd better send wires to put them all off . Even if [I]0-i did see it , [I]0-i dare not grudge [Yolande]52-yolande that fleeting triumph . Before the party was over — But let [me]0-i , above all , tell [my]0-i tale orderly . For the rest of that day [Mrs. Bates]98-mrs. bates and [Mary]75-mary wrought , unaided , in [the kitchen]236-the kitchen , for [Chloe]45-chloe , in the abrupt reaction from despair , became suddenly enlightened as to a far more important matter than even food . [She]45-chloe had nothing to wear , save yellow , which [Aunt George]100-aunt george could never abide , and pale blue , in which [Uncle Bletherthwaite]108-uncle bletherthwaite always remarked how washed - out [she]45-chloe looked . So the rest of the day passed in washing , dyeing , and ironing [her]45-chloe primrose - colored liberty silk . The dye was pale pink , a brilliant scarlet , or a deep crimson , according to the measure of its dilution . Several minor articles were irrevocably ocably ruined , and gallons of ruddy dye stood about [the bath - room]936-the bath - room in pails , before the right shade of delicate pink was achieved in one of [my]0-i best white silk ties . Then the primrose gown became rose - colored , and was rinsed and dried and ironed till it looked like a newly blown hollyhock blossom . “ [I]45-chloe wish there was something more to do , ”[45-chloe] [Chloe]45-chloe said , sighing ; “ it does seem such a pity to waste all this lovely dye . ”[938-an experimental chemist] [[My]0-i cousin]937-my cousin , [an experimental chemist]938-an experimental chemist , had given [me]0-i the dye , with the words : “ The only thing is , it 's such a pure , perfect color , [[your]0-i wife]2401-your wife will want to dye everything in [the house]1610-the house with it . Do n't let [her]2401-your wife ! ”[45-chloe] Thus forewarned , [I]0-i was firm , and [I]0-i carried away the pails . [Yolande]52-yolande followed [me]0-i , begging that the dye might not be thrown away . [She]52-yolande would find a use for it . So [I]0-i put it in the tool - shed among the rakes and forks , the garden syringe , and the grass - cutter — the only place where [I]0-i could feel sure that [no uncle]939-no uncle would kick it over inadvertently , [no aunt]940-no aunt absently sit down on it . And now it was the day of the house - warming . It was a fine day , and , acting on a sudden inspiration , [Yolande]52-yolande and [I]0-i rode over to [Blackheath]12-blackheath on [[our]941-our bicycles]942-our bicycles , returning laden with light , enormous mous parcels . They were colored Chinese lanterns . [We]941-our hung them from the trees near [the house]1610-the house . And then , further inspired , [I]0-i tore off for more , and [we]941-our strung them on wires and made [the house]1610-the house beautiful with them . [The big drawing - room]945-the big drawing - room , with [its]945-the big drawing - room evergreen garlands , [its]945-the big drawing - room little white - draped tables , sparkling with borrowed glass and silver , [its]945-the big drawing - room bowls of radiant dahlias , [its]945-the big drawing - room tall green glasses of Japanese anemones , [its]945-the big drawing - room pinkshaded candles , and over all the mellow glow of the many - colored lanterns , was a picture at which [our]941-our hearts beat high with pride . The sideboard groaned ( it really did groan , and that in no mere commonplace metaphorical way , but honestly , because it was , in its inmost heart , only packing - cases ) beneath the weight of as fine a cold supper as [any aunt]946-any aunt could wish to see , [any uncle]947-any uncle wish to eat . [Chloe]45-chloe 's pink hollyhock gown was an exquisite success . [Yolande]52-yolande 's was like a white hollyhock bloom . All was ready . The first wheels crushed the gravel of [[our]941-our drive]948-our drive . Gradually [the hall]1783-the hall filled . [Ponderous uncles]953-ponderous uncles and [portly aunts]954-portly aunts occupied the heavier chairs . [Lean aunts]955-lean aunts and [uncles]881-uncles stood conversing with frosty geniality . [A great - uncle]957-a great - uncle and [a second - cousin who had not spoken for years]958-a second - cousin who had not spoken for years — a family affair about a trust and [an Australian gold - mine]959-an australian gold - mine , nothing personally discreditable to either — sank [their]960-their old feud and found out how much [they]960-their still had in common , as [they]960-their discussed in a wheezy undertone the extraordinary extravagance of [[their]960-their host]961-their host and [hostess]962-hostess — agreeing almost cordially in the opinion that [we]963-we were living in a style far , far beyond [our]963-we means . [Cousins of every degree]964-cousins of every degree enthusiastically compared notes as to the difficulty of getting to [[our]963-we house]481-our house . [Three nice nieces]966-three nice nieces and [a manly nephew or two]967-a manly nephew or two offered conventional amiabilities to [[their]966-three nice nieces elders]968-their elders . [We]963-we had furnished and adorned [the hall]1783-the hall , and [no one]269-no one , [we]963-we felt , could look on [its]1783-the hall marble floor and wainscoted walls without feeling [himself]269-no one privileged in being allowed to take part in such a pageant , so admirably staged . [[My]0-i aunt]2228-my aunt [George]100-aunt george objected to the wainscot as dark and out of date , and said the marble floor was cold to the feet . [[My]0-i uncle]177-my uncle [Reginald]109-uncle reginald agreed with [her]100-aunt george , but added handsomely that [beggars]973-beggars must n't be [choosers]974-choosers , and no doubt [we]963-we were wise not to waste [our]963-we money on carpets . Altogether , everything was going splendidly . When the gong sounded [I]0-i think it was felt to be an extravagance . [I]0-i remedied this as far as [I]0-i could by telling [Aunt George]100-aunt george , as [I]0-i gave [her]100-aunt george [my]0-i arm , that the gong was a wedding - present to [Chloe]45-chloe . And so it was , but [I]0-i bought it . [We]963-we crowded into [the big drawing - room]945-the big drawing - room . Even [Aunt George]100-aunt george admitted that it looked very nice — but not until [I]0-i had asked [her]100-aunt george if it did n't . And then [she]100-aunt george said it would have looked better without those Christmas decorations ! These were [our]963-we loops and swags . [I]0-i saw more than [one uncle]976-one uncle cast a glance at the foot of the sideboard as [he]976-one uncle passed , and [I]0-i wondered in anguish whether the drapery had displaced itself and the naked packing - cases were disclosed to the shocked eyes of [aunts]2353-aunts . But [I]0-i could not see . Yet the suspense was unbearable . Under pretext of turning down a lamp , [I]0-i went to see . [I]0-i must know the worst . The worst was a row — a long row — of gold - topped bottles . [I]0-i flashed reproachful glances at [Chloe]45-chloe , and as [I]0-i passed behind [her]45-chloe chair , [she]45-chloe murmured : “ It 's all right . [Asti]90-asti . [The new tenant]2403-the new tenant . ”[75-mary] It seemed to [me]0-i , in [my]0-i agitation , to be like [the new tenant]2403-the new tenant 's cheek , and not at all like [Chloe]45-chloe , but this was no time for anything but the duties of [a host]979-a host . [I]0-i returned to [Aunt George]100-aunt george , who said , “ [I]0-i wish to goodness [you]0-i would n't run about so ! ”[0-i] [Mary]75-mary and [Mrs. Bates]98-mrs. bates waited , and the waiting ing was excellent . So was [the Chianti]110-the chianti , which was all [I]0-i had intended [our]980-our wine - bill to run to . But [the uncles]981-the uncles looked at the gold - topped bottles , so did [some of [the cousins]983-the cousins]982-some of the cousins . [The aunts]2356-the aunts looked away from [them]982-some of the cousins . So [I]0-i said : “ [Aunt George]100-aunt george , [we]980-our 've some very fine Italian sparkling wine here — a present . [I]0-i should like [you]100-aunt george to try it . ”[0-i] As soon as [I]0-i had said “ a present , ”[2228-my aunt] [I]0-i caught [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife 's shocked glance , and knew the truth ; [she]162-my wife had bought [the Asti]90-asti on the strength of [[our]980-our new tenant]1979-our new tenant . But the words were out ; so , in a few moments , were the corks . The avuncular condemnation of Italian vintages was almost unanimous — but avuncular eyes sparkled , and a sort of soft current of cheerfulness passed round [the room]1946-the room . [I]0-i did not know where to look , and [I]0-i believe [Chloe]45-chloe nearly wept . [I]0-i made some sort of speech — [I]0-i do n't know how . Having [one]1622-one 's health drunk like that is a thing that does n't happen often — thank goodness . So one feels it oddly . [The party]1008-the party “ went ”[45-chloe] like wildfire after that . The tables were cleared , then with the help of [nephews]1011-nephews and the less frail among [the cousins]983-the cousins , cleared away bodily . [Some one]404-some one sang — [an uncle]2062-an uncle , [I]0-i think ; [some one]404-some one sniffed — no doubt [an aunt]1022-an aunt ; and coffee was served at the absolutely right moment . Then shawls and hats were handed like refreshments , and [we]1009-us all trooped out into [the garden]223-the garden by [the moat]1669-the moat to look at the moonlight and the Chinese lanterns , craftily lighted by [Mrs. Bates]98-mrs. bates while [the cachucha]1025-the cachucha was enchanting [us]1009-us . The night was warm as June . But [Chloe]45-chloe always sat on the bough to keep it steady , so sawing can not count as [mere man]1157-mere man 's work . Rabbit - catching sounds manly enough , but [Chloe]45-chloe was in that too , more or less . The incident which led to the rabbiting was , however , [my]0-i show entirely , and [I]0-i confess to a certain pride in it . [My]0-i presence of mind , as well as [my]0-i dramatic ability , was called into play , and [I]0-i was pleased with [myself]0-i on both counts . [I]0-i was wandering in [the orchard]249-the orchard at dusk one evening , pushing through the long grass and nettles , and trying to fix in [my]0-i memory the way of the growing of apple - boughs for the ghost 's next illustration . The mists of October drifted like wraiths among the trees , and the scent of [wet earth]1159-wet earth had mingled with itself the perfume of sadness and regret and memory . In spring the wet earth smells of hope and joy and the green future . [I]0-i had stood in contemplation for some moments before the golden - pippin tree , and was really beginning to know [its]1160-its gnarled face by heart , when [I]0-i heard a scratch and a squeak , and a voice said , “ Got ' [i]0-i m ! ”[0-i] [I]0-i moved cautiously round [[my]0-i tree]1161-my tree . In [the open space beyond [the orchard]249-the orchard]1162-the open space beyond the orchard the wild rabbits have made [their]1164-their burrows , and here , grouped round one of [the rabbit - holes]1165-the rabbit - holes , were [two men]1166-two men , three dogs , [a boy]912-a boy , and several ferrets — [the last in bags]1168-the last in bags . [I]0-i was still unseen . [I]0-i reflected . If [I]0-i called on [these rabbit - thieves]1169-these rabbit - thieves to surrender , [they]1169-these rabbit - thieves would probably decline to do so on any terms . Indeed , why should [they]1169-these rabbit - thieves ? There were [six of [them]1169-these rabbit - thieves]1170-six of them , not counting the ferrets , and [I]0-i was only one . That was the point . If [I]0-i had only been three — or even two ! Could [I]0-i not be two , or even three ? How could it be done ? Arithmetic is a difficult branch of science . [We]1185-our housed [our]1185-our ferrets in [the stable]275-the stable and hung the nets in [the kitchen]236-the kitchen . [Chloe]45-chloe , in spite of [my]0-i warnings , was eagerly anxious to help . [She]45-chloe was more deft than any of [us]1185-our in staking the nets over the holes , and [she]45-chloe handled the ferrets lovingly , because [they]1194-they loved [her]45-chloe , and that was because [she]45-chloe always fed [them]1194-they . [We]1185-our had no dogs and no guns , and [I]0-i felt guiltily unsportsmanlike . At last all was ready ; each of [us]1185-our crouched by [his]1195-his appointed rabbit - hole . [I]0-i put in the handsomest ferret ; [he]1195-his disappeared , and [we]1185-our waited results in silence . Now and then [we]1185-our bent [our]1185-our heads to listen in quite a professional manner , as though [we]1185-our had been [real poachers]1196-real poachers , for some sound of what might be happening underground . And nothing whatever seemed to be happening . [We]1185-our grew cramped , and changed [our]1185-our positions . [Yolande]52-yolande heard the movement and called out , with insolent triumph , “ Any sport ? ”[1185-our] Indignantly [we]1185-our all said , “ Hush ! ”[98-mrs. bates] and the weary work of listening began again . Then , suddenly , just as hope had died in every breast , there was a rustle underground , a scamper - rush , a piteous little scream of horror and fear , and a small , fat gray rabbit bolted out of the earth into the net over the hole where [Chloe]45-chloe watched . [She]45-chloe had it in [her]45-chloe arms in an instant . [Yolande]52-yolande ! [I]0-i shrugged [my]0-i shoulders for the third time that day , and [I]0-i went in to [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife . [She]162-my wife was sitting by the fire in the beech - wood rocking - chair , singing low to [herself]162-my wife ; the song sounded like “ Bye , [baby bunting]2542-baby bunting . ”[52-yolande] [I]0-i suppose the rabbit put it into [her]162-my wife head . [I]0-i never regretted that rabbit . In three days it was perfectly tame ; in a week it played with the cats and sat up on the hearth - rug , unconcernedly washing its face . At the end of a fortnight it flopped after [Chloe]45-chloe , in and out , up - stairs and [down - stairs]1222-down - stairs , like a small and very plump kangaroo . When the cats grew too catty in [their]1223-their play the rabbit would turn round and use [his]1224-his deadly hind foot . [They]1223-their presently learned to respect this , and the rabbit was master of the hearth - rug . [Yolande]52-yolande went to see that coursing , [I]0-i believe , though [she]52-yolande never spoke to [Chloe]45-chloe of it . And [she]52-yolande listened to tales of tigers from [the tenant]2381-the tenant — more tales , and less convincing , than [I]0-i should have thought [any Girton girl]1226-any girton girl could have borne . [She]52-yolande also learned to take rose - cuttings , and did it without gloves . [I]0-i looked on in a frenzy of annoyance , which [I]0-i hid , even — indeed , most of all — from [Chloe]45-chloe . [The tenant]2381-the tenant is [a man of ideas]1228-a man of ideas — but [I]0-i never heard [him]2381-the tenant talk anything but the visible — concrete to [Yolande]52-yolande . [I]0-i felt a horrid suspicion that [he]2381-the tenant thought [her]52-yolande a bit of [a prig]1229-a prig , and that [he]2381-the tenant was actually daring to try to “ form [her]52-yolande ”[45-chloe] ; the audacity took [my]0-i breath away . But [Yolande]52-yolande was placid , and seemed to breathe without effort . Mindful of that scorned suggestion of [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife 's on the night of the first dinner - party at [the cottage]534-the cottage , [I]0-i looked straight before [me]0-i and cultivated an air of seeing nothing . [I]0-i sometimes wondered whether [Yolande]52-yolande imagined that [we]1232-we did not see anything , or whether [she]52-yolande knew [we]1232-we saw anything , and did not care , or whether [she]52-yolande really believed that there was nothing to see . [She]52-yolande had arranged , as usual , to personally conduct [three model young persons]1233-three model young persons on a winter tour through [the art treasures of [Italy]8-italy]1234-the art treasures of italy , and [her]52-yolande going was fixed for the week after Christmas . [She]52-yolande had [some private pupils]1235-some private pupils , and went up to struggle with [them]1235-some private pupils two or three times a week , but for the most part [she]52-yolande was with [us]1232-we . And [I]0-i was glad to have [her]52-yolande — first , because [she]52-yolande is ever a sight for sore eyes , and secondly , because [I]0-i began to see that [I]0-i did not want either to give up [my]0-i ghost - fathered pencil - work , nor yet , for some obscure reason which [I]0-i ca n't even indicate , to confess to [Chloe]45-chloe that it was not [Yolande]52-yolande , but [I]0-i , who had tinkered [her]52-yolande drawings . [My]0-i own work , [my]0-i writing , grew less and less important to [me]0-i — only the Weekly Wilderness still commanding the service of habit . The curious change whose initial throes [I]0-i had felt when first [we]1232-we came to [the Red House]187-the red house had worked in [Chloe]45-chloe and in [me]0-i , till now , while [the house]1610-the house was usually tidy to distraction , [Chloe]45-chloe 's wardrobes and chests were in the wildest confusion . “ [I]45-chloe know , ”[45-chloe] [she]45-chloe said one day , when [I]0-i opened a drawer and silently confronted [her]45-chloe with a swollen mass of lace , ribbons , handkerchiefs , scarfs , bead necklaces , letters , collars , wristbands , brass- headed nails , and the long - lost hammer , all inextricably tangled up with the ball of twine [I]0-i had been looking for—“I know . [You]0-i see , it is so important to keep [the house]1610-the house tidy — and [I]0-i do tidy up . ”[0-i] “ [You]45-chloe do , indeed , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , fishing up from the bottom of the drawer the penknife that [I]0-i had missed since last Tuesday week . “ Oh , [I]45-chloe am so sorry . And now [we]1290-our are [lords of the manor]1292-lords of the manor , holding the power of life and death over the field - days of [antiquarian societies]1293-antiquarian societies . ” “[0-i] What [I]0-i do n't like , ” [she]0-i went on , quite unappeased by this feudal picture , “[0-i] is that about the skating . Why should [antiquaries]1294-antiquaries want to skate ? ” “[0-i] Now to [me]0-i , ” [I]47-len rejoined , “[47-len] that 's the most convincing touch of all . Of course [these workmen]1295-these workmen do n't often get a holiday , and [they]1295-these workmen want to make the most of it . ‘ If the frost holds ’ is a charming touch . It 's hardly begun yet . ” It did not hold . [I]47-len signified to [Mr. Edward]130-mr. turnbull Turnbull [my]47-len gracious consent , and from that moment the snow began to melt , and the weather to settle itself down into something quite as warm and sunny as an English April , and far warmer than many an English May. A stray furze - bush or two at the end of [[our]1290-our paddock]2610-our paddock broke into golden flower , and the skylarks sang in the pale blue above [the orchard]249-the orchard . The 20th was a day of cloudless beauty , and even in the midst of [my]47-len mental congratulations to [the members of [the Antiquarian Society]2613-the antiquarian society]2612-the members of the antiquarian society on [their]2612-the members of the antiquarian society royal weather , [I]47-len found room for a pang of sympathy pathy for [those among [them]2612-the members of the antiquarian society who might have had [their]2614-those among them who might have had their skates ground skates ground]2614-those among them who might have had their skates ground . [I]47-len recurred again that day , [I]47-len remember , to [our]1290-our old life at [the Bandbox]179-the bandbox . [We]1290-our were sitting in [the loafery]2273-the loafery , now made cosey with curtains and a big wood fire . [Chloe]45-chloe sat sewing in [her]45-chloe rocking - chair . [She]45-chloe had had some verses that morning , and , bad as they were , they had pleased [her]45-chloe . There were seven stanzas , [I]47-len remember . The first two were quite ordinary , and the other five got sillier and sillier , till at the end they were a mere jingle of nonsense — a sort of nursery rhyme , mostly written in the “[47-len] little language . ” The poem — [Chloe]45-chloe really did call it a poem — began something like this : TO [CHLOE]45-chloe AT [WORK]2617-work [She]45-chloe liked it all , even the nonsense of the last five stanzas , and [she]45-chloe said that [she]45-chloe liked it none the less because it happened to be written on the backs of a green - grocer 's bill , the voting - card of [a candidate for [the school board]2619-the school board]2618-a candidate for the school board , and two odd envelopes . When [I]1298-those antiquarian brutes had picked everything up [we]1297-we went to the window . [The creeper]2620-the creeper 's leaves were gone now , and [we]1297-we stood between dull red curtains and looked out on [the misty garden]2621-the misty garden , where the dead leaves lay , patches of wet gold and brown in the faint sunlight , and where [a robin on a leafless apple - tree]2622-a robin on a leafless apple - tree was singing [his]2622-a robin on a leafless apple - tree very best , and pretending to the rooks in the elms that [he]2622-a robin on a leafless apple - tree was a thrush disguised in a scarlet waistcoat . “[1298-those antiquarian brutes] [Those Antiquarian brutes]1298-those antiquarian brutes , ” [I]131-the junior blackheath said , presently , “[131-the junior blackheath] [they]1298-those antiquarian brutes 'll be here directly . [I]0-i took a short - cut between [[Jim]48-jim 's celery - trenches]2625-jim 's celery - trenches . [I]0-i caught a few words : “[0-i] .... told the time when [Charles the First]132-charles the first was beheaded , and recorded the death - devouring progress of [the Great Plague]133-the great plague and the Fire of [London]4-london . [They]2137-the children had a very full flow of conversation , and a much larger vocabulary than [I]1343-i remember having at [their]2137-the children age . What struck [me]1343-i most was [their]2137-the children confident assumption that , now [we]2663-we knew [them]2137-the children , [we]2663-we could not help liking [them]2137-the children ; and the assumption was , [I]1343-i own , justified . [He]136-oswald evidently thought a good deal of [himself]136-oswald , but , as [I]1343-i could not but reluctantly acknowledge , with some justice ! [They]1343-i were extremely “[1343-i] free in [their]1343-i talk , ” as [Mary]75-mary said afterwards , but never vulgar . And [they]1343-i were very much funnier than [they]1343-i meant to be . [He]2676-the pale child made the most shocking grimaces [I]1346-he ever saw , but when [Chloe]45-chloe turned anxiously to [Oswald]136-oswald , [he]136-oswald said , “[1346-he] It 's all right ; [he]1346-he 's not ill ; it 's only the poetry working out of [him]1346-he . ” Presently [he]136-oswald stopped writing , folded the paper very small , and said suddenly and earnestly , “[1347-you] Have [you]1347-you got a secret staircase here ? ” [We]1348-we owned [our]1348-we indigence in this respect . “[1348-we] [We]1348-we have at [the Moat House]1349-the moat house , ” [he]136-oswald said . “[1347-you] Have [you]1347-you explored [[your]1347-you house]225-your house thoroughly ? ” “[1347-you] Yes , [I]0-i think so , ” said [Chloe]45-chloe , with a glorious inspiration , adding , “[1351-you] but [you]1351-you may explore it if [you]1351-you like . What [extraordinary children]1361-extraordinary children ! ” [I]627-children could hear the wave of [children]627-children surging wildly about [the house]1610-the house . [I]627-children lighted a cigarette , and strove for calm . [I]627-children seemed to have been living in the embrace of a friendly tornado . [[Our]2685-our cellars]2686-our cellars are large and vaulted ; from recollections of [my]0-i childhood , [I]0-i could conceive that they might seem well worth exploring . But [I]0-i had not all [Chloe]45-chloe 's confidence in [these strange children]2687-these strange children . [They]2701-these children were quite right . [YOLANDE]52-yolande was married — [she]52-yolande was married at [Elmhurst church]29-elmhurst , [Chloe]45-chloe and [I]1512-i [[her]52-yolande only supporters]2748-her only supporters . And after the wedding [we]1512-i all walked quietly down together from [the church]1954-the church and said “[1512-i] Good - bye ” to [them]2750-them at the door of [[their]2750-them cottage]2751-their cottage , through whose windows the welcoming firelight shone out into the cheerless January dusk . “[1512-i] What an ideal beginning to a honey - moon ! ” said [[my]150-frances wife]162-my wife . “[150-frances] Fancy walking straight [home]244-home to [[your]1514-you own house]1515-your own house . No broughams and slippers and things , no long railway journey and [horrid hotels]1516-horrid hotels and [lodgings]1517-lodgings , with the rice dropping out of [you]1514-you in showers every time [you]1514-you move an inch , and [everybody]1518-everybody grinning sympathetically after [you]1514-you . [Our]1522-we lines have fallen unto [us]1522-we in pleasant places . Come in . [Chloe]45-chloe 's daring adoption of [the Red House]187-the red house as [[our]1522-we home]1618-our home had been generously repaid . Instead of being the white elephant as which it had sometimes sought to disguise itself , it was now a credit to [us]1522-we , and an unchanging joy . [[Our]1522-we cottages]859-our cottages were let , and [[our]1522-we garden]1847-our garden . [Our]1522-we work in [the Red House]187-the red house had been prosperous , the memories that had grown up [there]1621-there were precious , the hopes more precious still . [Mary]75-mary was happier than ever , now that [she]75-mary had [a small servant]2759-a small servant — [her]75-mary slender personality wholly justified by [our]1522-we prosperity and [our]1522-we future — to teach and order about and be kind to . [Our]1522-we lives were peaceful , ordered , incredibly pleasant . And , indeed , such talk , while it intensified [my]0-i own aching passion of tenderness and solicitude , did , by its frank revelation of that passion , do more to calm and cheer [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife than all [my]0-i brave pretence — it was brave — of confident fearlessness had ever done . But [I]0-i have written already more than is needed . For it was March now , and the time of [our]1547-we great fear and [our]1547-we great happiness was very near . Once again in the history of [the Red House]187-the red house [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife and [I]0-i had changed parts . The hushed peace that brooded over [us]1547-we folded [us]1547-we in wings too soft and close to let any breath of outside tempest come near . [[Chloe]45-chloe 's mother]2771-chloe 's mother ( who is as nice as [any one]1966-any one could be who is not [Chloe]45-chloe , and is twice [Chloe]45-chloe 's age ) sprained an opportune ankle and could not come to [us]1547-we as [she]2771-chloe 's mother had intended , and as [I]0-i had thought [I]0-i wished . So that [[my]0-i wife]162-my wife and [I]0-i had these last days — the last , as [we]1547-we alternately prayed and feared — alone together . The doings of [Yolande]52-yolande and [[Yolande]52-yolande 's husband]2774-yolande 's husband were like a bright , gay embroidery on the rich fabric of [our]1547-we quiet happiness . And the time drew near . It was on the 1st of April — a too appropriate date , as [Yolande]52-yolande afterwards bewailed — that [Chloe]45-chloe suddenly realized , in an imperative shock , that there was a certain Japanese dressing - jacket pattern without which [she]52-yolande could not be happy another moment . [She]52-yolande had the stuff to make it , a demurely eccentric Eastern - patterned silk ; [she]52-yolande also had the material — a dull , soft blue — for what [she]52-yolande called the revers . [I]0-i suppose [a man]713-a man would call it the lining , but [I]0-i am not quite sure . So [she]52-yolande left a half - written story of the very strongest possible “[0-i] domestic interest ” ( it was , indeed , for [she]52-yolande was to get twenty pounds for the finished article ) to go down to [[Yolande]52-yolande 's cottage]2776-yolande 's cottage and borrow this priceless pattern which [Yolande]52-yolande was known to possess . And [I]1552-you , almost without a pang , abandoned a nearly finished drawing to go with [her]52-yolande . The buds were gray and green on the trees , on the lilacs the buds were bronze , and carmine on the creeper . The daffodils were out , and the tulips rigid with the energy of pride and promise . [We]2779-we walked up [the neat cottage garden]2780-the neat cottage garden , and [we]2779-we remembered the days of [Prosser]71-prosser and the rags and the dead mouse and the mutton - bone . [We]2779-we knocked at [the cottage]534-the cottage door . It was a very nice knocker — old brass . [Yolande]52-yolande — under [my]1552-you guidance — had picked it up for sevenpence at [a rag - and - bottle shop in [Deptford]22-deptford]2784-a rag - and - bottle shop in deptford . There was a long pause . Usually the door was opened almost coincidently with the fall of the knocker by pretty , fair - haired , cheery - faced [Mrs. Bates]98-mrs. bates , but now [we]2779-we stood long on the narrow doorstep and heard from within sounds of scuffling and rustling . [We]2779-we had time to see how right [Browning]152-browning was when [he]152-browning said , “[1552-you] The leaf - buds on the vine are woolly , ” and how very long before their white perfection come the green pledges of the annunciation lilies . [We]2779-we knocked again . The scuffle or rustle assured [us]2779-we that [some one]404-some one was within . This time it was [Chloe]45-chloe who knocked ; [she]45-chloe knocked vehemently , and almost on the instant the door was opened by [[our]2779-we tenant]1980-our tenant in person — [[our]2779-we tenant]1980-our tenant , resplendent in speckless frock - coat and gleaming high hat — the armor in which [he]1980-our tenant habitually leaves [[his]1980-our tenant home]2792-his home to fight with beasts in [the newspaper - offices of [Fleet Street]44-fleet street]2793-the newspaper - offices of fleet street . “[0-i] [I]0-i 'm rushing for [[my]0-i train]331-my train , ” [he]1980-our tenant said , hurriedly , and , indeed , its smoke showed already beyond the gray veil of leaf - buds on the trees of [[our]2779-we railway embankment]2794-our railway embankment . “[52-yolande] [I]0-i 'm glad [you]1555-you 've come . [[The ferret]2343-the ferret 's wife 's sister 's husband]1568-the ferret 's wife 's sister 's husband is ill , and [[the ferret]2343-the ferret 's wife]1535-the ferret 's wife has gone to nurse [her]1535-the ferret 's wife — ” “[1535-the ferret 's wife] Without asking [you]0-i ? ” “[1571-we] Of course [she]1535-the ferret 's wife asked [me]0-i . [We]1571-we drank it in respectful silence . “[1571-we] [We]1571-we 've been up since the middle of the night , ” [she]1535-the ferret 's wife went on , setting down [her]1535-the ferret 's wife empty tumbler . “[1575-my darling housemaid] [We]1571-we 're both involved in one common ruin . [He]1572-he lit the fires ; [I]0-i got the breakfast . Then [he]1572-he found [he]1572-he had no socks mended , and — and there were buttons . [Chloe]45-chloe , [Chloe]45-chloe ! And now it was May , and the sweet - plumed lilac was out , the red and white hawthorns were in bud - round , shining beads of coral and pearl . [The garden]223-the garden had forgotten the lean days of winter and was all curves and softnesses in its new green gown ; fat thrushes hopped and pecked on the wide , wet lawns .
